column4: I have a program trying to use a binary called C++ to compile, but I can't find any tool named C++ in the repositories, help please?
Where could I find this tool?
sudo apt-get install build-essential <<< do that and you will get C++ and lots more
oh... I thought I already had it...
what are you trying to compile?
I can't find a libsvg-cairo  so I suggest you check out what is around using apt-cache search libsvg and cairo and see if it works for you
as I said I did not find it but you might find something there
it wasn't in the cache. I think I'll check the cairo website.
that would be a good idea
actually Google found it for me... I should have done that first, but how do I install it? :o
why do I have to compile it? X( can't I just drop it in some directory?
it looks like a lib and being part of something else read the read me on it
consider this place as a signpost towards a solution we may not know exactly what it is you need but we most likely know which road you need to walk
